Text: CAN U DISABLE ALL THE ANNOYIN FEATURES THT POPS UP ON U MORE WHILE?
What in the hell are you talking about? You mean Security Centre? Go to control panel and work it out from there or google "Disable [Feature here]"

ummmm, when i installed it said XP Pro!
Is this pro with MCE features installed or is this just Pro!
nevermind, its XP Pre with Media Center SLIPSTREAMED, i give it a 5, i wanted the ORIGINAL MCE!
I can upload the original MCE, however I find this easier as it only uses one disc, whereas the standard one is 2 discs. And there is no discernable difference between them both :)
sounds great downloading now great instructions and i like how you include poweriso although i already have it.
desperately needs seeders will seed when done

Torrent_Meister, you mentioned that you can upload the original MCE that comes in 2 Disks.  I have been removing viruses and from my laptop and now it keeps asking for disk 2 of MCE.  I really need this 2 Disk version (specifically XP MCE 2002 SP2).  Can you please upload?  It would help me out greatly.
-appjock

For folks who got in the same bind as me with a sony Vaio VGC-RC110G. Yes, this cd works. Not all the drivers for things like the ethernet and audio. But it will absolutely get you past the "No Drives Found" issue. THANKS SEEDERS!!! YOU GUYS ARE MY SAVIOR!
Works perfectly. No issues at all on an ancient Vaio RZ 22G. Thanks so much.
Fine work sir!  Works like a champ.

If you cannot use this to repair-install an existing Media Center installation, then it is NOT "kosher", and you didn't make it right.

So....does it?

= = = = = =

FIRST RULE OF WINDOWS XP CD "BUILDS":

-- If they don't support "repair-install", then they are:

SHIT.

Why? A clean-install of XP is the biggest fucking pain in the ass if you have anything newer than a Pentium III, because you'll be missing half the drivers, and it'll be a goddamn chore to hunt all the fuckers down.

And every uploader who doesn't say whether repair-install is supported needs to be punched in the head until he shapes up.

(Been looking, for years, for a clear repair-install capable CD of Media Center which does NOT demand a serial half-way through.)
Asks for a product-key halfway through the install.
